Name: chlorpropham production | chlorpropham | EN15804GD, U
Category: C:Manufacturing/20:Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products/201:Manufacture of basic chemicals, fertilizers and nitrogen compounds, plastics/2011:Manufacture of basic chemicals
Description: Chlorpropham is produced in two steps from chloronitrobenzene. Chloronitrobenzen is hydrogenated to metachloroaniline and reacted with isopropyl chloroformate.;C6H4NO2Cl+3H2 --> C6H6NCl+2H2O;C6H6NCl+C4H7O2Cl --> C10H12O2NCl+HCl;isopropyl chloroformate (C4H7O2Cl) is produced from phosgene and isopropanol:;COCl2+C3H8O --> C4H7O2Cl+HCl;Sodium hydroxide is added to neutralize the formed hydrochloric acid.;Reference(s):;Unger T., (1996). Pesticide Synthesis Handbook, Noyes Publication.;Appleby A.P., Muller F., Carpy, S., (2011): Weed Control, in Ullmanns Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry, Weinheim, Wiley-VCH.
